description: The story revolves around four teens — the good-looking twins Yuuta and Yuuki Asaba, the effeminate Shun Matsuoka, and the class head Kaname Tsukahara — who have known each other since early childhood. While they are not necessarily good or bad friends, they continue to hang out well into high school. The half-Japanese transfer student Chizuru Tachibana joins the circle of friends in this comedy about the everyday life of adolescence.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Cute Boys Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around male characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Iyashikei
tags.description: Primary aim is to heal the audience through serene depictions of characters' daily lives.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

node.description:
[Agency Profile](https://junction99.com/?page_id=1134)

He joined a theater troupe when he was 4 years old, and two years later made his acting debut in the historical drama Korczak. He remained with the theater troupe until March 2006, when he moved to Junction.

Made his voice acting debut in 1996 on [Taiho Shichauzo](https://anilist.co/anime/1577/). He auditioned and got the role of [Haku](https://anilist.co/character/385/) in the 2001 film [Spirited Away](https://anilist.co/anime/199/). The same year, he voiced the eponymous main character in [PaRappa The Rapper](https://anilist.co/anime/3736/), and the following year he started voicing Sora in the Kingdom Hearts video game series, a character who he still voices to this day.

He released his debut mini-album Soleil on June 26, 2009 and his first single album, Faith, on November 25, 2009. Since May 2010, he and [Hiroshi Kamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/95118/) formed a music duo called [KAmiYU](https://anilist.co/staff/116031/). Their first mini-album "link-up" was released on August 3, 2011.

Announced his marriage with an unspecified woman on September 3, 2021.

__Non-anime voice roles:__
- Sora - *Kingdom Hearts* series (VG)
- Cyno - *Genshin Impact* (VG)

__Height:__ 162 cm __Hobbies and abilities:__ drums, guitar, singing, dancing, painting __[Website](http://www.toyonaga.info/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/tossy-t/) | [Web Diary](http://set.cocolog-nifty.com/toshi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/TossuiKUN) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/16256.html) | [Super Eccentric Theater](http://www.set1979.com/member/%E8%B1%8A%E6%B0%B8-%E5%88%A9%E8%A1%8C/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/toshiyuki.toyonaga.9) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/豊永利行)__ He is a Japanese voice actor, actor, singer, songwriter and composer (under T. Toyonaga), and has ranked 7th nationally in the drummania rankings. He is currently affiliated with Super Eccentric Theater INC. Non-anime roles: ~! Kachiroh Kato in "Musical Tennis no Oujisama: Dream Live 2nd" (Musical) Kachiroh Kato in "Musical Tennis no Oujisama: Dream Live 3rd" (Musical) Kachiroh Kato in "Musical Tennis no Oujisama: Side Fudomine in winter ~special match~ 2004-2005" (Musical) Kachiroh Kato in "Musical Tennis no Oujisama: Side Yamabuki feat. St. Rudolph in winter 2004-2005" (Musical) Kachiroh Kato in "Musical Tennis no Oujisama: The Imperial Match in winter 2005-2006 " (Musical) Kachiroh Kato in "Musical Tennis no Oujisama: The Imperial Match" (Musical) Kachiroh Kato in "Prince of Tennis Musical 2" (play) Kachiroh Kato in "Prince of Tennis Musical 3" (play) Kachiroh Kato in "Prince of Tennis Musical" (play) Kachiroh Kato in "Prince of Tennis: Dream Live 1st" (concert/play) Kaede Okumura in "Prince of Stride" (VG) (Japanese) Kei Percival in "Caladrius" (VG) (Japanese) Mikado Ryūgamine in "Durarara!! 3way standoff" (VG/PSP) (Japanese) Mine Ryutaroh's friend in "Nodame Cantabile" (TV series) Random person typing back to 731 in "Densha Otoko" (TV series) Shota Hikasa in "Battle Royale II" (movie) Sousei Tachibana in "Yumeiro Cast" (VG) (Japanese) Xiba in "Soul Calibur V" (VG/PS3,Xbox 360) (Japanese) Jiaoqiu in "Honkai: Star Rail (VG) (Japanese !~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/onoyuki19840622) | [Official Website](http://www.onoyuki.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/onoyuki_official/)

__Height:__ 167cm

Yuuki Ono is a Japanese voice actor and singer who dubs in anime shows and video games. He was represented by Atomic Monkey and is now a freelancer. His major roles are: Josuke Higashikata in JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Diamond Is Unbreakable, Taiga Kagami in Kuroko's Basketball, Zenkichi Hitoyoshi in Medaka Box, Kaname Tsukahara in Kimi to Boku, Masayuki Hori in Monthly Girls' Nozaki-kun and Ishisaki Jun in Ace of Diamond. 

On October 2, 2017, Ono announced his marriage from the last seven years prior in his blog post. His wife is a person who works outside the entertainment industry. On August 2020, Ono announced the birth of his first child.

**Non-Anime Roles**
- Jiyan - Wuthering Waves (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ryouhey_Drunk) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCP-evNobN1MJ61xHb8tAhcg)

Won Best Supporting Actor at the 6th Annual Seiyuu Awards for his performance as Kodaka Hasegawa in _Boku wa Tomodachi ga Sukunai_. Also part of the trio Trignal with fellow seiyuu [Takuya Eguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102695/Eguchi-Takuya) and [Tsubasa Yonaga](https://anilist.co/staff/95556), and a host of the Kiramune label's radio programs.

Non-Anime Roles:


~!
• Childe (Genshin Impact)
• Hyde Kido (Under Night In-Birth)
• Touri Wataru (Hanaemu Kare to & bloom)!~

__Height:__ 177 cm 
__Agency:__ Gekidan Himawari  
__Awards:__  Best New Actor at the 5th Annual Seiyuu Awards (2011)  
__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Lean (Final Fantasy Type 0)
- Ventus, Roxas (Kingdom Hearts series)
- Neku Sakuraba (The World Ends With You)
- Banagher Links (Mobile Suit Gundam: Gundam vs. Gundam Next)
- Rinne Rokudo (Kyoukai no Rinne trailer)
- Enma Kozato (Katekyo Hitman REBORN! Vomic)
- Razor (Genshin Impact)
- Rean Schwarzer (The Legend of Heroes Series)
- Protagonist (Persona 5: The Phantom X)
!~

[Profile](https://profile.himawari.net/view/1559)

Koki Uchiyama is a Japanese actor and voice actor from Saitama Prefecture affiliated with Himawari Theatre Group.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

After graduating from Miyakojima Technical Senior High School, Kanbe moved to Tokyo and went to a Professional Training College while delivering newspapers to maintain himself. He joined Studio [Topcraft](https://anilist.co/studio/363/Topcraft) and as his first job he worked as production assistant on [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/Nausica-of-the-Valley-of-the-Wind/).

In the late '80s and early '90s he worked on several NHK educational anime for children while he had his debut as director with the OVA [Ninja Ryuukenden](https://anilist.co/anime/619/Ninja-Ryuukenden/) in 1991. 

In 1997 he established Studio Garan with several employees of [Studio Junio](https://anilist.co/studio/280/Studio-Junio) (which he had previously joined). Garan was one of the subcontracting studios for [Cardcaptor Sakura](https://anilist.co/anime/232/Cardcaptor-Sakura/) and the episodes Kanbe directed garnered much attention. He left Garan in 2000.

More recently he's been mainly known for directing psychological and thriller anime like [Elfen Lied](https://anilist.co/anime/226/Elfen-Lied/), [Electromagnetic Girlfriend](https://anilist.co/anime/5177/Electromagnetic-Girlfriend/) and [The Promised Neverland](https://anilist.co/anime/101759/The-Promised-Neverland/).
7!! (seven ooops, セブン・ウップス) is a band from Okinawa formed in 2004.  Members: Michiru (Guitar) Nanae (Vocal) Maiko (Drums) Keita (Base)

__[Official Website](http://www.shouta-aoi.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/noboru0811) | [Personal Twitter](https://twitter.com/shouta0811aoi) | [Professional Twitter](https://twitter.com/AOISHOUTAstaff) | [Youtube Channel](https://www.youtube.com/c/aoishoutaKING)__

Singer and voice actor since February 2011. Used to have a complex about his feminine voice, but he got over it because people liked that type of unique voice.

Ryuunosuke Matsushita in _Kimi to Boku_ was his first anime role. He also sings many insert songs in the same anime. Ai Mikaze from _UtaPri_ series is the role that made him popular. Debuted with the mini-album "Blue Bird" on June 26, 2013.
Masato Nakayama is a composer and former member of the music production group Elements Garden.
